message: Hi, I was wondering if there were any plans to introduce revision control on top of grids, packages and grid-package-features. Apparently users are automatically trusted upon subscriptions and can edit content at will. The quality of content on djangopackages.com seems pretty good, so maybe edit limitations are not needed?
Would be awesome to hear what strategies you guys are thinking about :)
An option that will soon be available will allow you to switch between open to registered users and a mode that allows you to assign permissions for various tasks.
@ptone cool, sounds like a lot of work :) I heard someone was working on badges and scores, maybe a stackoverflow permission system could be conceptualized?
Yeah, permissions are a big issue for Packaginator. Preston is quickly becoming our permissions guru. :)
Or rather, @ptone is quickly becoming our permissions guru

@jamespaxi you can check it out here: https://github.com/cartwheelweb/packaginator/pull/111
most of the work now will be managing merges with other changes to the templates
A subsequent phase at permissions could look at object-row level permissions, instead of just object permissions
@pydanny thanks, I saw you merged one of my pull requests - I'll make two more little ones in sequence, then will continue with something new.
